markdownRemark.html:
Introduction

Rich Hicky gave an insightful talk on the role of type. He presents incisive commentary on the use of exhaustive typing enforced (and praised) by languages like Haskell. A part of the issue strict typing reveals, as he outlines for us, is that programming at a high-level is the process of automating tasks and procedures that exist in a domain. Programs are good at automating well-defined repetitive (or scripted) tasks, in well-defined domains. With the advent of more advanced techniques such as Machine Learning see computers automating tasks in more fuzzy domains. Either way programs, at the least the ones we care to keep around, operate inside of some kind of domain.
